text.content:
Welcome to the Exploration module.

The purpose of this module is to help you teach parents how young children explore the world around them and learn through their interactions with the environment.

Exploration is how children use the information gathered by their senses to learn about the world. These processes start during infancy and become more sophisticated as children get older and new neural circuits build on old ones.

Educator Training Goals:

Present research that defines the concept of exploration and explains why exploration is an important tool in cognitive learning.

Describe how young children test their environment.

Provide parents with information about how children test their hypotheses, gather evidence, and use these experiences to understand their world.

graphic.notes: #21 6 mo. Noel - 6-40 from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition
#25 17 mo. Shea Qin - 67-128 from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition
Page 11 - Taylor in plant from Exploration folder in Learning & Cognition

audio.transcript: Welcome to the Exploration module. The purpose of this module is to help you teach parents how young children explore the world around them and learn through their interactions with the environment.

In this module, you'll learn that exploration is how children use the information gathered by their senses to learn about the world. These processes start during infancy and become more sophisticated as children get older and new neural circuits build on old ones.

After completing this module, you will be able to 1) Present research that defines the concept of exploration and explains why exploration is an important tool in cognitive learning. 2) Describe how young children test their environment. And 3) provide parents with information about how children test their hypotheses, gather evidence, and use these experiences to understand their world. To begin, click a Topic in the bottom menu.
